bug.short_desc: support LDAP auxprop fetching via an external process

long_desc.thetext:
it would be really nice to support an LDAP auxprop plugin. because of the (somewhat silly?) way cyrus imap & sendmail work, we probably want to have a different process for communicating to the LDAP server. (so similiar to saslauthd but more of an auxpropd.)
unfortunately, that will make documentation increasingly complex.
igor: parallel bug to investigate auxprop/ldap issues, if you're interested.
Created an attachment (id=53) Chris Newman's description of what an auxpropd would look like

I will try as much as my time permits. I am working on a fairly large cyrus deployment. ;) I will need help with client|server coding. It looks like saslauthd with modified protocol. LDAP portion is mostly done. Do you want to move sasldb, mysql to auxpropd as well?
Related note: Howard Chu and openldap folks are working on an ldap auxprop plugin similar to sasldb.
Unrelated Note: I have Cyrus Imapd 2.1.5, fairly fresh SASL from CVS and saslauthd/LDAP working on Solaris 9 in a small production environment. ;)

Chris newman has actually said he might be able to donate some code to us (since it helps him if we are compatible). So, I wouldn't place it at a very high priority at all.
The OpenLDAP folks are aware of this effort as well (and are interested in it)...

This sounds good. I'll look thru the code and see what can be done.
Chris's spec suggests the use of loopback interface for ipc. Perhaps, saslauthd can be modified as well to use loopback interface rather than unix socket? This should elimitate Solaris unix socket problem.

I suppose, but using Solaris Doors has already gotten around the problem on Solaris.
Doors won't work for what chris proposes, since it can handle more than one request at a time (it is stream oriented), while doors are more request/response oriented (like the datagram sockets that are used otherwise by saslauthd).
Created an attachment (id=151) Chris Newman's auxpropd implementation

authserv.c:
Linux (RedHat at least), doesn't have iovec_t, so we can either replace it with 'struct iovec' or do 'typedef struct iovec iovec_t'. The former might be more portable and easier to maintain.
Created an attachment (id=153) PAM backend for Newman's authserv

Is authserv (auxpropd) going to remain as is (threaded) or is the protocol going to be ported to saslauthd? The reason I am asking this is that ldap module in its current state cannot use persistent ldap connection in the thread server (the same applies to mysql and possibly other modules). Otherwise I need develop some kind of connection pooling.

Its not going to be grafted on top of saslauthd. That said, I haven't spent enough time with the new authserv code to decide what I want to do with it.
I don't think leaving it as a threaded application is unreasonable.
LDAPDB plugin partially addressed this, even though it is not a separate process.

attachment.desc: Chris Newman's description of what an auxpropd would look like
